org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.time
Class EventDrivenGridTime

java.lang.Object
  org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.time.SimpleGridTime
      org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.time.EventDrivenGridTime
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdvanceableTime, GridTime
public class EventDrivenGridTime
extends SimpleGridTime
implements AdvanceableTime

EventDrivenGridTime uses a TimeAdvancer to control the value of simulation time. Threads calling gtWait, gtSleep or gtJoin are assigned to WaitObjects which store the time they should wake up (Long.MAX_VALUE when no wake up time is given) and added to a List of waiting threads in the TimeAdvancer. When all the threads are asleep, the TimeAdvancer looks to find the first thread to be woken up, calculates the difference between this time and the current time, advances the time by calling advanceTime(long) and wakes up the thread. Using this method of measuring time, it only increases when there is no thread activity, hence the time for calculations is not taken into account. This timing model moves OptorSim towards an event-driven simulation rather than time-driven.

Time is initialised at today's date and the time given in the parameters file.

Copyright (c) 2004 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

gtWait

public void gtWait(java.lang.Object waitOn)
Threads calling this method with Object o are made to wait until gtNotify(Object o) is called with the same Object. A WaitObject with long value Long.MAX_VALUE is assigned to the Object. A typical call to this method is time.gtWait(this).

Specified by:
gtWait in interface GridTime
Overrides:
gtWait in class SimpleGridTime
Parameters:
waitOn - Usually the object from which this method was called.

gtWait

public void gtWait(java.lang.Object waitOn,
                   long timeToWait)
Threads calling this method with Object o are made to wait until gtNotify(Object o) is called with the same Object or they are notified by the TimeAdvancer. A WaitObject with long value timeToWait is assigned to the Object. A typical call to this method is time.gtWait(this, timeToWait).

Specified by:
gtWait in interface GridTime
Overrides:
gtWait in class SimpleGridTime
Parameters:
waitOn - Usually the object from which this method was called.
timeToWait - The time in ms the thread should wait for.

gtSleep

public void gtSleep(long delay)
Threads calling this method are made to wait on an arbitrary object with a value representing the time it is due to be woken up. The TimeAdvancer will wake the thread up delay ms after this method is called.

Specified by:
gtSleep in interface GridTime
Overrides:
gtSleep in class SimpleGridTime
Parameters:
delay - The time in ms the thread should sleep for.
